author: The Canadian Press
description: Immigration Minister Lena Diab is extending until 2027 the pause on new applications through the Private Sponsorship for Refugees Program as the department works to clear its backlog. New ministerial instructions were published in the Canada Gazette today along with a notice on the Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada website. This pause applies to refugee […]
title: Immigration Minister Extends Pause on New Private Refugee Sponsorships to 2027

author: Jill McLaughlin
description: The US encourages foreign governments and allies to engage more with citizens who are concerned about mass migration.
title: US Asks Embassies to Report Human Rights, Public Safety Impacts of Mass Migration

author: Matthew Horwood
description: U.S. Vice President JD Vance says the stagnation of living standards in Canada is due to a rapid rise in immigration rather than to tariffs imposed by the United States. Vance made the comments while reacing to a post on X indicating that Canada’s per-capita GDP has remained stagnant since 2018. He said the reasons […]
title: JD Vance Wades Into Canadian Immigration Debate

author: Collin May
description: Raymond Aron warned in 1967 that anti-Semitism was taking a new, more insidious form. His insights still hold true today.
title: The New Anti-Semitism Hides Behind the Language of Virtue

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Conservative MP Michelle Rempel Garner says her party plans to put forward multiple amendments to border security Bill C-12 aiming to strengthen Canada’s asylum process and immigration system. Bill C-12 was tabled by the Liberals on Oct. 8 and is now being studied in the House of Commons public safety committee. “I think Canadians want […]
title: Conservatives Plan to Propose Stricter Asylum Rules in Amendments to Border Bill

author: The Canadian Press
description: Correctional Service Canada ended up with a $1.1 million bill for repairs after an inmate at a New Brunswick prison broke two sprinklers. The damage was reported in last year’s public accounts, an annual report on government spending, recently tabled by the federal government. A Correctional Service Canada spokesperson said the incident occurred at the […]
title: Two Broken Prison Sprinklers Cost Correctional Service Canada $1.1M

author: Chandra Philip
description: The Alberta government has tabled legislation that, if passed, will limit the power of regulatory bodies to discipline members for off-duty comments and behaviour. The legislation known as the Regulated Professions Neutrality Act, commonly referred to as the Peterson Law, is named after Canadian psychologist Jordan Peterson, who faced sanctions from the College of Psychologists […]
title: Alberta Introduces Bill to Limit Power of Regulatory Bodies on Members’ Actions

author: The Canadian Press
description: The royal charter that created Hudson’s Bay in 1670 is on its way to the auction block. Ontario Superior Court judge Peter Osborne on Friday approved a process that will see the document owned by the defunct retailer sold early next month. The auction will kick off with an $18-million bid from holding companies belonging […]
title: Court Approves Hudson’s Bay Plan to Auction Its Royal Charter; $18M Bid Expected

author: The Canadian Press
description: Saab’s CEO is making it clear that his company’s decision on whether to set up shop in Canada will depend on whether Ottawa decides to buy its Gripen aircraft. “To transfer technology and build a hub in a country that would not use the aircraft themselves and have the connection with the end user doesn’t […]
title: Saab CEO Says Plan to Build Gripen Jets in Canada Depends on Ottawa Making an Order

author: Nathan Worcester, Ryan Morgan
description: Trump has not ruled out the possibility of U.S. strikes on land-based targets or other military action against Venezuela specifically.
title: House Democrats Seek to Block Funding for US Military Action Against Venezuela

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: More pistachio and pistachio-containing products are being recalled in Canada as federal health officials continue to investigate an ongoing outbreak of salmonella infections. The Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) has issued recall notices for several products sold by vendors in southern Ontario and online. The items were distributed in Alberta, British Columbia, Manitoba, New Brunswick, […]
title: More Pistachio Products Recalled Across Canada as Salmonella Outbreak Continues

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The prime minister’s right-hand man told MPs Mark Carney holds himself to the highest ethical standards and his ethics screen is “rigorous.” Carney’s chief of staff, Marc-André Blanchard, made the comment while appearing before the House of Commons ethics committee on Nov. 20. His appearance was part of the committee’s review of the Conflict of […]
title: Carney’s Chief of Staff Defends Conflict-of-Interest Screen in Committee

author: Noé Chartier
description: Though Canada’s purchase of F-35 fighter jets is still under review, causing concerns in the United States, Defence Minister David McGuinty said cooperation between the two countries remains robust. “It is important to remember that Canada and the United States continue to cooperate on defence, security, and intelligence,” McGuinty said during an unrelated defence announcement […]
title: Defence Cooperation With US Remains Strong Amid F-35 Review, Minister McGuinty Says

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney says his government is working on a $1 billion project to expand Canada’s critical minerals processing capacity, while the United Arab Emirates (UAE) has agreed to commit the equivalent of $70 billion in Canada. The announcements come as Carney concluded his week to Abu Dhabi, UAE, this week. Carney said during […]
title: UAE Commits $70B to Projects in Canada’s ‘Vital Sectors’ During Carney’s Visit

author: Guy Birchall
description: The plan would see Kyiv cede territory to Moscow, reduce its armed forces, and abandon its hopes of joining NATO all together.
title: Trump Admin’s Proposed 28-Point Russia–Ukraine Peace Plan: What’s in It?

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Seven Canadians have been apprehended for extradition to the United States as part of an investigation involving a former Canadian Olympian-turned-alleged drug lord who is wanted for the murder of a federal witness in January. Ontario, Quebec, and Alberta residents were identified by the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ), the FBI, and the RCMP this […]
title: 7 Canadians Tied to Former Olympian and Alleged Cocaine Kingpin Ryan Wedding Arrested for Extradition to US

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Zelenskyy said Ukraine may face a choice between 'loss of dignity' or losing key U.S. support.
title: Zelenskyy Says Ukraine Faces ‘Difficult’ Crossroads as It Weighs Trump’s 28-Point Peace Plan

author: The Canadian Press
description: Canada will contribute just over $1 billion over the next three years to the Global Fund to fight infectious diseases in the world’s poorest countries. Cindy Termorshuizen, Prime Minister Mark Carney’s personal representative for the G20 summit in South Africa, made the announcement today in Johannesburg ahead of Carney’s arrival at the summit. The Global […]
title: Canada Announces $1B for Global Fund to Fight Infectious Diseases

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The IAEA said verification of Iran’s uranium enrichment is long overdue after months without inspector access.
title: Iran Condemns IAEA Resolution, Says Cairo Deal Is Void

author: Victoria Friedman
description: On Oct. 31, Trump said he would be redesignating Nigeria as a country of particular concern, saying Christianity was facing an 'existential threat' there.
title: US Considering Pentagon Engagement, Sanctions to Compel Nigeria to Tackle Christian Persecution

author: C.P. Champion
description: Commentary Fewer than one in ten Canadians own a second house or cottage, according to Statistics Canada. Most who do are well off, or have inherited a place they share with siblings. When it comes to our prime ministers, we hardly begrudge them access to an escape from the stress and strain of leadership, like […]
title: The Historic Cottages and Getaways of Prime Ministers

author: Guy Birchall
description: The Trump administration confirmed on Nov. 20 that it had formulated a plan to end the war between Russia and Ukraine.
title: Zelenskyy Ready for ‘Honest’ Work on US-backed Plan as Europeans Express Concern

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Australia has launched an emergency safety response after asbestos was discovered in Chinese-manufactured wind turbines parts.
title: Asbestos Found in Chinese-Made Wind Turbine Parts Used in Australia

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A coroner's report on the killing of two police officers and a nearby neighbour at a rural Queensland property in 2022 has been handed down.
title: Coroner Finds Police Killers ‘Morally Insane’, Not Terrorists or Christian Extremists

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: On a diplomatic visit to India, Wong also spoke about China being a major regional force.
title: Indian Energy Giant Cuts Russia Oil Flow After Wong Urges Supply Chain Caution

author: Nicole James
description: Calendula: the cheap, low-risk skin fix hiding in plain sight.
title: The Medieval Soup Ingredient That Can Still Beat Your $150 Serum

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Virgin’s ban begins Dec. 1, while Qantas and Jetstar will enforce stricter rules from Dec. 15.
title: New Restrictions on Power Banks for Aussie Travellers Following Cabin Fire

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Pinterest and Roblox remain exempt from the ban coming into effect from Dec. 10.
title: Twitch Added to Australia’s Under-16 Social Media Ban

author: Carolina Avendano
description: Alberta’s move to allow a parallel private surgery system alongside the public health system has raised concerns among opposition and advocacy groups, who say it violates federal health-funding rules. Premier Danielle Smith announced the proposal on Nov. 19, saying that letting surgeons perform privately funded surgeries during their off-hours will shorten public wait times without […]
title: How Alberta’s Private-Public Surgery Model May Work Without Violating Federal Funding Rules

author: Reuters
description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te showed his support for Japan on Thursday with a lunch of Japanese-sourced sushi.
title: Taiwan President Shows Support for Japan in China Dispute With Sushi Lunch

author: Reuters
description: South Korea's coast guard launched an investigation on Thursday into a ferry that ran aground overnight.
title: South Korea Arrests Crew Members for Negligence After Ferry Runs Aground

author: The Associated Press
description: PHNOM PENH, Cambodia—A passenger bus in Cambodia crashed off a bridge into a river, killing at least 16 passengers and injuring two dozen others, police said. The bus was traveling from Siem Reap, home to the fabled Angkor Wat temple complex, to the capital Phnom Penh, when it crashed early Thursday morning in the central […]
title: Night Bus From Cambodia’s Top Tourist Destination Plunges Off Bridge, Killing 16 Passengers

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. Premier David Eby said he was disappointed and surprised to hear Alberta and the federal government are working on an energy deal that could involve removing parts of the oil tanker ban on B.C.’s north coast. A Nov. 19 report by the Globe and Mail citing unnamed government sources said Ottawa and Alberta are […]
title: Smith, Eby Address Proposed Alberta–BC Pipeline After News Leaks to Media

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Victorians identifying as trans or 'gender diverse' will no longer have to pay a fee to change sex on their documentation.
title: Victoria to Waive $140 Fee for Changing Birth Certificates

author: Chandra Philip
description: Canadians are looking for ways to save on grocery bills as the cost of food remains a top concern, according to a recent survey. The Canadian Food Sentiment Index by the Agri-Food Analytics Lab at Dalhousie University in Halifax, released on Nov. 20, looks at Canadians’ views on food affordability and purchasing behaviours. Four in […]
title: Canadians Say Grocery Costs Remain a Top Concern: Survey

author: Chandra Philip
description: Ontario’s government says it will be introducing legislation that would require public-sector organizations to buy provincially produced products first. The province said the “Buy Ontario Act” would apply to all public sector organizations, ministries, agencies, and municipalities. Minister of Public and Business Service Delivery and Procurement Stephen Crawford said the legislation would protect jobs in […]
title: Ontario Government Says It Will Introduce Legislation to Keep Procurement Dollars in the Province

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: She replaces Mark Speakman, who formally resigned on Nov. 20 after mounting pressure inside the party.
title: Kellie Sloane Takes NSW Liberal Leadership Unopposed After Speakman Steps Aside

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Legal proceedings are underway in Edmonton to decide whether an Alberta separatist group is allowed to launch a referendum on whether or not the province should separate from Canada and become a sovereign nation. During deliberations that began Nov. 19 and are set to run to Nov. 21, Justice Colin Feasby of the Court of […]
title: Court Deciding Whether Alberta Independence Group Can Hold a Referendum
